Comment 2: 
This is also affecting nacl/amd64p32.

The problem is that the collector doesn't see any reference
to the ParFor* stored in runtimeÂ·work.markfor so it frees it
and a later allocation will take it's place.

Here's an alloctrace run (with uninteresting bits elided):

tracealloc(0x10446000, 0x50, runtime.parfor)
...
tracegc()
    markfor 0x10446000 nthrmax 32 
...
tracefree(0x10446000, 0x50)
...
tracealloc(0x10446000, 0x70, map.bucket[string]*unicode.RangeTable)
...
tracegc()
    markfor 0x10446000 nthrmax 0

desc=0x10446000 nthr=1 nthrmax=0 count=8 body=0x74130
fatal error: parfor: invalid args

runtime stack:
runtime.throw(0x30bead)
    /usr/ality/go/src/runtime/panic.go:465 +0x83 fp=0x3ffffd40 sp=0x3ffffd28
runtime.parforsetup(0x10446000, 0x1, 0x8, 0x0, 0x76000, 0x74130)
    /usr/ality/go/src/runtime/parfor.c:33 +0x73 fp=0x3ffffd6c sp=0x3ffffd40
gc(0x3ffffea8)
    /usr/ality/go/src/runtime/mgc0.c:1355 +0x1ad fp=0x3ffffe98 sp=0x3ffffd6c
runtime.gc_m()
    /usr/ality/go/src/runtime/mgc0.c:1305 +0xcd fp=0x3ffffeb8 sp=0x3ffffe98
runtime.onM(0x31c178)
    /usr/ality/go/src/runtime/asm_386.s:266 +0x4f fp=0x3ffffebc sp=0x3ffffeb8
runtime.mstart()
    /usr/ality/go/src/runtime/proc.c:785 fp=0x3ffffec0 sp=0x3ffffebc
